reviews.text: Excellent food, great service, good atmosphere

I almost don't want to promote it because we got a reservation for 6 on a Saturday with no problem but this place should be packed.  Pizza with arugula & prosciutto and hot & sweet calamari for appetizers were so good we all were saying we kind of wished we didn't order entrees so we could double up on the apps.  Dinners didn't disappoint,  flounder oreganata fresh & tasty no overwhelming garlic taste which happens with oreganata,  pasta puttanesca was wow, porkchop delish, bolognese yum- every dish was a home run. House pinot grigio was very good,  coconut creme brulee was to die for. Service was terrific and the restaurant small and unassuming but really i put it above my all time favorite neighborhood spot ginos.
Best place for Italian in Brooklyn. Food was phenomenal and service was exceptional. We are looking forward to visiting when we are vacationing again.

We live near this restaurant and have never sat inside to eat only ordered for delivery. This is now one of our favorite places to eat! Not only is it a local spot but the food is delicious and the service is amazing! The waiters are so attentive and give great suggestions. Special shout out to Alberto for the delicious choice on an appetizer. The place is small but cozy. Love it and will definitely be returning customers.
Sorry...much more expensive than 4 months ago...no juice is served also
Prices are 30% higher...can't go anymore..$140 for 2, no alcohol..simple order
I love this place. The food never fails. Always delicious. Tastes like your grandma made this food. The service is great here

Nice place, not very big. Staff is really friendly, but it's almost comical how they don't really listen. We ordered a white gluten free pizza, but they delivered a regular one. I asked for linguini with my clams instead of spaghetti, but still got spaghetti. That said, the food was tasty, the company was great and the staff was very friendly and accommodating. The "off " orders were not significant enough to ruin our experience. Oh yeah, they put caramel sauce on the plate under my cannoli.  Try it, the food is good and staff very friendly. I think we just caught them on an off night.

Been meaning to try this place for 6+ months but kept postponing because Italian food in Bay Ridge/Dyker is usually inedible (looking at you Brooklyn Roots with your microwaved pasta). After a long night out, we gave this place a try for late lunch/early dinner and ever since then I canâ€™t wait to go back. Made to order absolutely delicious fresh pasta, lovely welcoming service, decent wine menu (although, I had beer), and definitely decent prices for the food theyâ€™re serving. Now only if they make their wine menu online and rotatingâ€¦

What a hidden treasure. Amazing all around great food, friendly staff,
great prices, 5 stars all the way. Sorry, there is no picture of the food, just the ending

This was the most amazing dinner.  We ate 2 appetizers because we couldnâ€™t choose, fabulous pastas and sauces, and the cannolis were the perfect finishing touch.  The staff was so kind and attentive.  Exactly what you imagine a Brooklyn Italian restaurant should be!

The experience was not the best.

First off, the place was noisy, but since we were with our 2 year old daughter who was hungry and needed to use the bathroom, we stayed.
We ordered the octopus appetizer. BIG MISTAKE! The octopus was frozen, and they cut it in a way that included the inside and the beak!
The waitresses were all in a rush, and dismissed me with an attitude of "I'm too busy for you."
We had ordered spaghetti with butter for our daughter, to which they charged as if it were an elaborated plate ($21), and a lasagna, which we ended up canceling.
When we returned the octopus and asked for the check, they charged us for everything and were in a rush to kick us out.

I will not come back, and wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

This place was absolutely fabulous! The food was amazing, as well as the atmosphere and service. When you were in the Brooklynn area or Dyker Heights, make sure you stop by for a fabulous meal! You will not be disappointed. â™¥ï¸

I had an amazing experience at Annabelle The food was absolutely delicious, with every dish bursting with flavor and beautifully presented. The staff was friendly, attentive, and made us feel so welcome. The ambiance was perfectâ€”cozy and inviting, making it an ideal spot for a special evening out. I highly recommend trying their steak and pasta .I canâ€™t wait to come back and enjoy another wonderful meal here.
Excellent Italian-American family restaurant. They are very consistent with their quality of food and you can often find the owner working there. Canâ€™t go wrong with this place!

Sehr leckere Pasta, sehr guter Service.
Kann nur weiterempfehlen.
Everything was perfect, server was attentive and warm and kind. Would love to come back!!!
This restaurant was conveniently located just across the street from my hotel. I really enjoyed it. Az.
Great place, food fantastic!
Good spot to come and have a good Italian meal. The prices are decent.

The best mushroom lasagna anywhere. The mini cannoli is just perfect. In the Fall they have a delicious Pumpkin Ravioli.
It is a go to place for Italian food. Not your everyday Italian restaurant, but very good at what they do.
The service is always attentive. Love this place. The atmosphere is cozy and subdued, not loud.
Delicious and love the atmosphere! We visit Dyker Heights during Christmas time each year and this is the perfect place to stop by and have dinner at. The food does not disappoint!

Calamari (excellent)
Octopus carpaccio (ok)
Clams (not fresh, mentioned to the server)
Hanger steak (ok, don't recommend)
Pork chop (great, moist, but a bit salty)
Rigatoni Bolognese (great)

Visited twice during a long weekend in NY, because once wasn't enough! Awesome food, authentic, home cooked and you can tell the difference. Try the pear ravioli it is to die for! Great service, friendly atmoshpere makes it even better and more delightful! Enjoy I know you will.
Excellent food, nice service. Very recommendable
One of the best pesto pastas Iâ€™ve ever had! Amazing quality meal and you can tell itâ€™s homemade fresh pasta

Never written a review before, but the porkchop I was served at Annabelles Pastaria was more than worthy. The minute this post-pig landed on my table, I felt something in my heart stir. The juices swirled as the scent of porkchop-perfection filled the air. Excited, I eagerly cut open the tender meat to discover a rich pink sear on the inside. Expectations high, I took my first bite. Instantly, I experienced a whole array of taste I never knew was possible, each chew releasing a new explosion of flavor. I sat there, stunned, never having known such food induced pleasure was possible. I couldn't possibly bear to keep The Chop to myself, and one by one, introduced it to each of my colleagues. They too fell helpless victim to its sheer deliciousness, proclaiming it "the best piece of meat I've ever eaten" and "a bite for the ages." As a harsh food connoisseur, I have never given a food a 10/10, and that won't change today. The Chop could never be rated on a human scale, being inhuman in nature. The Chop could only have been fabricated by something otherworldly; a pig treated like a holy relic, fed only the finest foods in elephantine proportions. Without question, the best food to ever happen to me. Head down to Annabelles Pastaria to get your very own porkchop experience today

A comfortable spot. The food was good. Went to try their gluten free options because of celiac. The owner has it and the staff is very attentive to that requirement. Always great to find a place that has a full GF menu even if itâ€™s not dedicated.
Pleasure! Surprised. Great, I fully have a new place .

Annabelleâ€™s did not deliver for Valentines Day. I wanted to stay local but still make the night special for the occasion, and Annabelleâ€™s did not help with that. Their food was pretty good, but that is the only positive of my experience. My date and I waited an hour and a half for our appetizer. We had a 6:00pm reservation and when we arrived, there were 2 other couples there, so to wait an hour and a half for an appetizer was ridiculous. Iâ€™m not sure if they were low on staff but they should have prioritized their customers dining in person. There were a lot of delivery service orders being processed and that took time away from satisfying their customers in house.

When we arrived at the restaurant there were only 2 other tables with customers. We waited an hour for our food to be served and had a cappuccino that tasted like it was made from a instant  powdered mix.  It was missing the flavor of coffee. Probably the last time we eat there.

Service was slow, instant cappuccino is what you crave try it at Annbella's. Bring your own knife to cut the meat,butter knives are not to be used for cutting veal or steaks. But that's what you have to use at Annbellas( butter knives).

Highly recommended.
Terrific appetizers, baked clams, Melanzana diavolo pizza.
Excellent penne anabelle , spaghetti with calamari, eggplant, Parmesan.
Oh incredible desserts strawberry Panna Cota ,tiramisu , and gelatos all top notch.
You wonâ€™t be disappointed.

This place was amazing. Called them 10 min to 6pm on a Sunday and they were able to get a table for 18 people done for us with no wait. The food was amazing to say the least and the service was absolutely amazing and they did everything they could for our huge group. This will be our go to spot anytime we are back in brooklyn.

Great restaurant.  Delicious Italian.  My husbandâ€™s mother is an 87 year old straight from Italy.  Her lasagna is his favorite meal ever.  He ordered the lasagna.  I said, ohhhh, youâ€™re gonna be sorry!!!  He loved loved loved it.  Said it was just as good, if not better, than his moms.  I had the chicken Marsala which was also fantastic.  Very friendly staff.  Nice atmosphere.

Pear Ravioli - 5/5
Marina Pasta - 4/5
Bruschetta - 4/5
Penne Annabelle - 3/5

The food is good.
Staff soft skills need to improve
Gratuity 20% for 4 or more people

Iâ€™ve been there many times. We travel from bellmore NY. This is the first complaint I have with Annabellaâ€™s. The food was always fantastic, delicious. The owners are great.
We went Dec 22, took my brother in law and cousin for first time. The appetizers were very good. The main meal I was in shock that it was not good. The chicken franchese was very tough my wife sent it back they gave her a new one but that also was very tough. We didnâ€™t say anything. My veal parm  meal was also very thick and tough again I didnâ€™t complain.  And finally they didnâ€™t have the great pizza that they are known for saying itâ€™s to busy because of the dyker lights   Ok I can understand. And I will go back again but way after the holidays. I know they just had a bad day
Sehr schÃ¶nes Restaurant mit fantastischem Essen. Die Bedienung war sehr nett, allerdings mussten wir extrem lang auf unser Essen warten, obwohl es nicht voll war.

Had a nice quiet lunch here on a weekday. Surprised there were not a lot of patrons because everything we had was delicious. There is a lunch menu but rather than having wraps or paninis we wanted to try their pasta dishes. I haven't had a good pesto dish in a while and their bucatini pesto was delicious. After eating this the pear ravioli was like dessert.  Clean restrooms. Restaurant is away from the 86th street foot and bus traffic. Worth walking a few blocks away from the shopping district.
Really enjoyed eating here. Staff were great, food was delicious! You could tel it was fresh made.

Nettes italienisches Restaurant mut Sehr aufmerksamem Personal.
Kleine Karte aber frisch gemachte Speisen in guter QualitÃ¤t
We had a soup and it was delicious. More than worth it. Very friendly staff as well. Thank you for having us.

JÃ¡ na chegada, o garÃ§om nos recebeu e nos instalou em Ã³tima mesa. O restaurante Ã© bem acolhedor e aconchegante. O pÃ£o veio quentinho. Pedimos massa. O molho pesto Ã© maravilhoso. E o molho Putanesca tambÃ©m estava divino. E para fechar, o cannoli perfeito em tamanho e sabor
Recomendo.
Great place I would highly recommend.

We had dinner today at 6:20 pm. Very long service. We waited for a small pizza for 50 minutes. They didn't even bring bread. People who came after us received their order first. I don't mind coming here hungry. An hour of waiting is unbearable.

Nice place. A bit noisy because it can get crowded. The food is good. Prices are somewhat decent. Staff is great. Would come here again.

Came again:
Service is very good. The atmosphere is just like how we remember it. However, because it's raining it's not as packed.
Forgot the name of the dish, it was a pasta with cheese, baked penne, I think. It is one of their better dishes. Was delicious.
Food was delish - portions were huge. Service was superb. Definitely coming back.
Deliciousness
Food and service very good. A homey atmosphere.
This has got to be my favorite spot ever. The quality of their pasta is amazing and I have nothing bad to say about it.

Me my wife and my cousin went here and it was absolutely fantastic! Food was way above Expectation of even the best restaurant i've been to. The service was unmatched. The atmosphere is absolutely stunning. This place is a gem in dyker heights and it is one that we all should support for many many years to come.

Delightful!  Service was so attentive! Food was delicious, with generous portions and very tasty. A very intimate and relaxed atmosphere. (wish they also had a full liquor license, but a minor item). Enjoyed our family dinner there and highly recommend!

Great place. Exposed brick wall decor gives it a warm old world feel. Service is top notch and hits all the marks. Our server Francisco is extremely knowledgeable, attentive and very polite. From appetizer to dessert everything was delicious. Appetizers: Baby Rice Balls (amazing flavor) and Octopus Carpaccio (very fresh). Main course: Chicken Lucia (juicy flavorful chicken) and the Clams in White Sauce (fresh, hot and perfect). Highly recommend this gem of a restaurant.

What can I say, the food was delicious! The service was on point. And the space was comfortable. I got the stuffed shrimp and my friend got the chicken martini. They were both wonderful. We also had a baked clam appetizer which was ok. The clams were small but good tasting.

Definitely worth trying.

Love this small and cozy place, wish I discovered it before. Visited them in their happy hours from 12-3 Monday to  Saturday, had a very delicious pasta with cream sauce for only 15$ , definitely worth it!

Waiter was really polite and pleasant,  food came pretty fast. For sure place to recommend and visit.  Will go there again for sure!

Wonderful food and service. Very fresh handmade pastas and all of the entrees and desserts were delicious.
Staff was very professional and friendly.

This is a little Italian gem located next to burgerfi. Second time coming here with family group over 8 people. The food is delicious. I got the tagliatelle Maria with grilled chicken (fresh pasta made daily).They cut the chicken up and mixed it with the pasta which was amazing compared to just putting sliced grilled chicken on top. The sweet and spicy calamari is different and delicious. Their standard grandma style pizza is very good as well. The setting is very a comfy NYC Italian vibe. The service is top notch as well. Courteous and attentive staff that suites the quality of food provided. Great date spot or family dinner. They also have more items on the menu than the website menu shows. Definitely will be coming back.

I usually only order Italian food when I'm in the mood for tiramisu, and while the meatballs with ricotta I got were good, this might've been the worst tiramisu I've eaten in my life. It didn't taste bad, it just didn't taste like any tiramisu I've ever had. Like if someone had just handed it to me and told me to try it I don't think I'd know what it was supposed to be. It doesn't even really look like tiramisu (pic is from their Seamless). I even googled "traditional Tiramisu recipe" because I know Italian food in America tends not to actually be authentic but none of the results resembled what I got from this place. Barely any cocoa powder and if there was any espresso in it I couldn't taste it. Anyway I'm not saying you shouldn't eat here, just don't order the tiramisu if you do.
Perfect spot in Dyker.  Food was great and the service was spot-on.  Will definitely be going back here!
I came here again recently with family and it was just as good as the first time we went. I highly recommend giving this place a try.
The food was amazing! The Tagliatelle Maria was the absolute best and their white pizza was ğŸ‘Œ I'm back for the delicious food and the great serviceâœ¨â€¦
Loved the fresh made pasta!  The pizzas are not too shabby either.

I recently dined at this Italian restaurant in Brooklyn and was blown away by the delicious food and exceptional service. The chicken parmigiana, grilled chicken with broccoli robe, and mushroom lasagna were all expertly prepared and absolutely delicious. Christine, the owner, was a pleasure to speak with and her passion for her restaurant was evident in the quality of the food. As an independently owned and operated establishment, this restaurant truly stands out. Our server, Tiffany, was also amazing and added to the overall enjoyable dining experience. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for authentic Italian cuisine and top-notch service. Youâ€™ll feel just at home here!

Went to celebrate birthday dinner service was on point staff was so nice and always made sure we was ok. Spacious and clean food was amazing and fresh. Nothing to complain about. Everything was excellent will be coming back again. Kids enjoy the family enjoy everyone left happy and full highly recommend

I've been going to Annabelle's for three years and within the last year the quality has completely gone down the drain. This review was spurred by a recent meal we had. We ordered Wings, and a salad for apps followed by a Grandma Pie andâ€¦

We are from out of town and happened into the restaurant. It was a phenomenal food experience. The handmade pastas and saucers were beyond belief. We had a group of 4 and we all ordered something different and everything was absolutely extraordinary. It was the best lasagna Iâ€™ve ever had!!!
